ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] [PROPOSAL] Version numbering
ygData.msgSnippet: Sounds good. We could also use an ever-changing tag like current to point to whichever releaseis recommended for outside users, and then give CVS

Sounds good.

We could also use an ever-changing tag like 'current' to point to
whichever releaseis recommended for outside users, and then give
CVS instructions that fetch 'current', whatever it is, correct?

- Gordon

Michael Stack wrote:
> 1. Let the crawler versioning scheme be MAJOR.MINOR.POINT_VERSION w/ 
> qualifier of '-dev' while building toward 'stable' versions. Examples 
> would be 0.1.1-dev, 1.0.23, 2.0.1, etc. 
> 2. Let our first release be 0.1.0. 
> 3. Let increments to MAJOR or MINOR merit branching. Let the branch be 
> named MAJOR.MINOR (I think '.' is disallowed so will have to be 
> MAJOR_MINOR).
> 4. Releases made along a branch should only ever be bug fixes and should 
> only ever increment POINT_VERSION. Such releases should be tagged 
> MAJOR.MINOR.POINT_VERSION (Keeping this scheme, we'll be able to easily 
> distingush branches and tags looking at cvs logs).  
> 5. Adding significant functionality should merit an increment to MINOR 
> number while a suite of new functionality would merit an increase in 
> MAJOR numbering (This last bullet item is pretty nebulous.  I think 
> it'll just be "obvious" when its time to roll the MAJOR rather than MINOR).
> 
> St.Ack
> 
>
